fields.name: trip_id_scheduled
fields.title: ID referencing GTFS trips.trip_id
fields.description: Identifies the scheduled trip associated with the trip performed. One scheduled trip may be associated with multiple operated trips, or an operated trip may not be associated with a scheduled trip. References GTFS

fields.name: route_type
fields.description: Indicates the type of transportation used on a route. References GTFS

fields.name: shape_id
fields.title: ID referencing shapes.shape_id
fields.description: Identifies a geospatial shape that describes the vehicle travel path for a trip. References GTFS

fields.name: direction_id
fields.description: Indicates the direction of travel for a trip. References GTFS

fields.name: block_id
fields.title: ID referencing trips.block_id
fields.description: Identifies the block to which the trip belongs. A block consists of a single trip, or many sequential trips made using the same vehicle, defined by shared service days and block_id. A block_id can have trips with different service days, making distinct blocks. See example in GTFS documentation. References GTFS

fields.name: schedule_trip_start
fields.description: Scheduled departure time from the trip’s origin.

fields.name: schedule_trip_end
fields.description: Scheduled end timestamp at the trip’s destination.

fields.name: actual_trip_start
fields.description: Timestamp at which the vehicle departed its origin.

fields.name: actual_trip_end
fields.description: Timestamp at which the vehicle arrived at its destination.

fields.name: in_service
fields.description: Indicates status of travel with regard to service.

enum: Returning to a garage due to a suspension or breakdown
Travel for on-route replacement of breakdown

fields.name: schedule_relationship
fields.description: Indicates the status of the trip. References GTFS-realtime TripUpdate.trip.schedule_relationship

name: trips_performed.schema.json
description: Trips performed for each service date.
